title: Invest in Panther Minerals | Critical Resource Development
meta_description: Discover investment opportunities with Panther Minerals, a leader in critical mineral exploration driving sustainable resource development in Canada.

				 Strengthening U.S. Domestic Uranium Supply 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 Strengthening U.S. energy independence through the exploration and development of the Boulder Creek Project, a district-scale uranium project located in Western Alaska 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				
				
			 
				
				
				
				
				
				
				 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 Company Overview 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 Leveraging Historic Exploration 
						 Leveraging +$3.5M previously spent on exploration – Historical Estimate (non 43-101 compliant) 1 M lbs U308 @ 0.27% ¹ 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 District-Scale Land Package 
						 The consolidation of mining districts near Boulder Creek has expanded the land package by ~75 times, from 90 hectares to 9,065 hectares, setting the stage for large-scale exploration 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 Fireweed Target Discovery (Boulder Creek 2.0) 
						 Historical airborne radiometric anomalies at Fireweed are stronger and more widespread than at Boulder Creek warranting detailed exploration and evaluation ² 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 Infrastructure 
						 Existing air strip and infrastructure at Boulder Creek and 50 km from Elim and 170 km from Nome, which serves as the regional transportation and service hub 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 Untapped Discovery Potential 
						 We believe that, despite limited exploration activities since 2007, there is significant potential for the Boulder Creek Property. By reevaluating geological data and utilizing modern exploration techniques, we aim to unlock its full potential 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
					 
					 
						 Domestic U.S. Production Needed 
						 In the past 5 years (2019-2023), the U.S. nuclear power fleet used approximately 250 million pounds of U308, while domestic uranium production totaled only 446,170 pounds 
					 
				 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 (Source: 1. Pubs.USGS.gov – “Geology and Origin of the Death Valley Uranium Deposit, Seward Peninsula, Alaska” Economic Geology, Volume 82, 1987, pp. 1558-1574 ) (Source: 2. – Triex mineral Coro., FORM 51-502F1, MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS For the Six Months Ended January 31, 2008)
 A qualified person (as defined in NI 43-101) has not done sufficient work to verify the historical information on which the conceptual exploration target is based. Additional work, including drilling, will be required to confirm the presence of uranium, and, if present, to establish the amount and grade of any mineralization that is found. The Company is not treating the historical information as reliable, and it should not be relied upon). 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				
				
			 
				
				
				
				
				
				 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 A Strategic Investment for a Clean Energy Future  
			 
				
				
				
				
				 The shift to clean energy is increasing the demand for nuclear power, which provides reliable, low-carbon electricity. This demand is driving up uranium prices, creating a strong investment opportunity.  
			 
				  Download Report 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 Nuclear Energy: Powering the Clean Energy Transition 
 Nuclear energy demand is rising as countries seek clean baseload power to meet zero-carbon targets. Global uranium demand is projected to increase by 28% by 2030 and nearly double by 2040. Additionally, the growing data center industry is driving further demand for uranium. 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 Constrained Supply Creates Opportunity 
 The global uranium supply chain is concentrated, with Kazakhstan holding a dominant position (43% of production). 
 This concentration creates vulnerability to geopolitical risks and potential export disruptions. 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
			 
				 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 Uranium Prices Soaring, Outlook Bullish 
 Uranium prices have reached a 16-year high of $90 per pound and are projected to keep rising due to the growing demand-supply imbalance. 
 Analysts forecast prices to reach $105/lb by 2025 and $115/lb by 2030, with a long-term bullish outlook. 
			 
			 
				
				
				
				
				 
				
				
				
				
				 Strong Fundamentals: Investing in a Secure Future 
 Long-term contracts for uranium are rising, indicating robust future demand. Declining inventories suggest potential supply shortages. Coupled with strong government support for domestic production in key markets, these factors create a compelling investment opportunity in uranium.
